I was really expecting to see some great game play improvements, but they are not there.  I am almost done the campaign and frankly finding it boring.  I am finding the AI so predictable and dumb.  There are some maps where you can pick off a large number of enemies from great distances and all that the enemy AI does is basically run around in circles.  Moving from one cover to another.  When in close quarters it is just as bad.  Hide beside an object, whistle, one enemy comes, stealth take down, whistle for the next enemy to come.  Done missions where I have knocked out all but the assignation target without detection.  Done missions where I have killed everyone without detection.  Started to use the SMG more due to boredom.  I have also found that the player movement is more clunky than previous versions of the game.  

Really disappointed that they have not improved the AI.  This is such a key part to make these games great.  Frankly I am not finding much of a challenge to this game other than going for various ribbons/metals/achievements. 

The environments are beautiful and big.  They have done a great job with this again.  

Buy only on sale.  Treat as DLC for SE4.

If your a fan of previous Sniper Elite's you'll probably like this one too. While there isn't a huge list of levels (9 or 10 if you have the DLC) the levels/maps are quite huge with loads of collectables and optional objectives. If your going in silent you'll get at least an hour or so in each level (minus the last level lol).

It's not 100% perfect, there are a few glitches/bugs and such but in the 19 hours I've played so far I've only really ran into 2 bugs that I had to re-load from a save (so either its not too bad, or I'm lucky compared to others). The graphics are nice, it runs great on my system and the X-ray system has been upgraded/improved like they always do in each game (imo).

Some new features are being able to customise your character for both SP and Axis mode, as well a load of options to upgrade and unlock weapons. What is Axis Invasion? It's basically an online mode where you join a random person whos playing the campaign and your mission is to basically kill them and you win (otherwise you get taken out and you lose). If the player is taken out by the other enemies you also win (I am terrible at the mode, but its quite fun). You also get to request a rematch.

I've not attempted the other modes yet but basically finished the game (while taking my time, and not playing it every day) but its quite short to a degree, but as I said I took my time and like to go for the silent approach so I got hours out of the levels myself.

Completed all the objectives in the first level. So far, the game is undeniably fun, I just wish there was more freedom when exploring the map. It appears "open" however the developers made it so that you can only choose between a few predetermined paths. This does not bother me that much, as the core gameplay experience is exciting and addictive. Hopefully in later levels the map becomes more open.

UPDATE:

This is my first SE game. Over the last few days a lot of my free time has been spent playing this game. Simply put, it is fun! There's a good mix of realism and arcade-y elements which makes it so that it's always a breeze to pick up and play for short or long periods of time. 

I have to add how well optimised this game is. My rig is about 8 years old and it runs between 60-70fps on medium settings.

The MP is surprisingly good. It is slow paced, which I prefer. You can attempt to "run-and-gun" however that'll usually end up with a you dying swiftly. Careful positioning and environmental awareness is rewarded handsomely. I have yet to finish the SP campaign because potshotting players is just so much fun honestly. Even just assuming the recon role with your binoculars and marking players is satisfying as you see your team pick off the targets you've marked. The only thing lacking is map selection. Hopefully they'll add more in future updates. I also appreciate how you can host and join custom games with custom rules. 

Currently, I'm on mission 4 in the campaign and I can happily say that the first mission is the most linear. As I progressed the levels seemed to open up more. There are numerous ways to reach and complete your objective. I'll get back to the campaign eventually, once I've had my fill of MP for a while!

Please don't let the negative reviews dissuade you from buying this game. It is well worth your time.

UPDATE 2:

Finished the game on hard and currently playing through on authentic. (mostly co-op with invasions enabled.) Feels like I'm playing a different game to a lot of naysayers. I have encountered a few bugs however some of the points made about the AI being broken I simply have not encountered. They do not see me through terrain and respond according to my visibility (terrain and shadows) and stance. Can't get enough of this game! Invasions are intense and honestly a game changer. I can see many franchises such as Hitman or Splinter Cell including this mode in future iterations.

I am a huge fan with hundreds of hours in Sniper Elite 3 and 4. At the moment this game is a disappointment and not worth the $80 I spent. Buy Sniper Elite 4. I will change my review if this game somehow gets its shit together. I hate pre ordering games and being let down..sad..

Do I like this game? Yeah, I do. But if I pay a hundred dollars for a video game, it shouldn't feel like I'm playing a beta test. The revolver stops reloading and firing if you use an item. Regular, boring house windows are inexplicably bulletproof. The game is much more finicky about what you can and can't climb over which makes the movement much clunkier and less fluid. There's sound bugs, janky animation transitions, and a whole slew of other issues that really detract from the game. Honestly, I'm kind of disappointed. There's a lot of changes and additions from SE4 that I like (bayonets, first-person iron sights, anti-tank rifles, customization, the new weapon pickup system, etc) but in terms of level design, playability and polish, I think that Sniper Elite 4 was much better.

Now I know we live in a repugnant reality where it's the norm for games to get pushed out slightly broken and be fixed over the course of a few months, instead of being perfected for launch, so I'm sure things will improve in time. That being said, I don't have to be happy about it. I like this game and everything, but in some ways it feels like a step backwards and there's plenty of issues to iron out still. I'm hoping that they tweak the traversal and get rid of all the invisible walls, and they BETTER fix all the other issues. I love Sniper Elite 4 to death and I feel like there's a lot of potential here, but this game still needs work. I'm sure they'll clean it up more, but I would hold off on buying it until they do, unless you can get it at a discount or something. In the meantime, I would just stick with 4.

I’m not sure what all the negative reviews are about with this game.  This is my first review on Steam because I had to set the record straight since I am a fan of this series and have played them all except Sniper Elite VR.  Sniper Elite 4 set the standard in my opinion and Rebellion stayed true with Sniper Elite 5.  27 hours in and I’m loving it as much as I loved Sniper Elite 4.  However, I do miss the trip wire traps...frowns.

Axis Invasions is a nice touch which I am finding a blast (another player joins the Germans to try and stop you during campaign missions).  Yes, you can’t camp once someone invades but this makes sense.  The maps are expansive and if camping was allowed, I could see how frustration could ensue hours after not being able to find your opponent.  I can also see how some of us could enjoy an hours-long hunt.  Perhaps a camp setting that can be turned on or off would be a nice addition to this concept.  As of now you can simply turn Axis Invasions off and camp all you want.  In fact, I suggest turning it off if you are trying to unlock weapons, complete certain tasks, etc.  My plan is to finish levels collect and unlock everything then go back to replay with Axis Invasions on.

Rebellion has added the x-ray cam to all weapons to happen more often as well which is awesome.  For example, if you use your pistol at a certain distance, it almost always jumps into effect.  I’m dropping my two cents because the negative reviews almost turned me off this game.  It was inevitable as a fan that I wouldn’t give it a try anyway so here I am.  My point is that if you really enjoyed Sniper Elite 4, you will enjoy this one and I highly recommend that you give it a chance.

I actually was hesitant to play Sniper Elite 5 based on the reviews being left. Particularly complaints about the game attempting to be "Woke" by putting Characters of Color or females as resistance fighters throughout france. 
But this is actually decently accurate to how things were at the time. With the French Governement offering citizenship to people willing to fight, this still continues with the French Foreign Legon today. 
The Shooting Mechanics of the game are just as satisfying as players of previous games would remember. 
My only complaint is some lack of polish of some of the buildings. Where I might melee an enemy from a doorway and pull them through the doorframe because of the animation, or be standing inside of a nearby wall. I also have occasionally ran across areas where I might see between textures and seen the sky where I clearly shouldn't.  
Still overall the game is a satisfying experience and the Survival mission (When playing with friends) is fantastic. Can't say I'm a fan of intrusions by other players, but the setting to turn those off is easy enough to find in the settings.

I can't recommend getting this game at this point . . . it has more bugs than a flea-infested camel. 


Enemies that stay standing, dead but otherwise untouched, after a grenade to the head; vehicles and bodies disappearing after a few minutes; bodies stuck half under the map, or sticking through walls ; game updates not getting installed; can't untag items; troops in endless "investigating" loops . . . I could go on with quite a list, but most has already been covered here at length by other reviewers.

This is basically released in beta form, and I have no idea how this was released in this shape as any of these issues are blatantly obvious with even minimum play-testing . . . either they didn't test it,  didn't give a damn about releasing an unpolished turd, or don't have the talent to figure out the issues.  

Whatever, at this point they don't deserve to be paid for this as it sits . . . maybe after a LOT of fixing. Too bad, because with a bit of proper management this could have been an amazing game.

Pros:
1. Satisfying gunplay. Sniper rifles aren't the only weapons that feel good to shoot
2. Large and complex maps with lots of places to explore
3. Very detailed slow-time kill cams that allow you to see your bullets pierce through enemies organs
5. Invasion mode is a nice addition to gameplay
6. Enough contents to keep you entertained for at least 30 hours

Cons:
1. The graphics are kinda outdated by today's standard (still acceptable to me though)
2. The anti-aliasing is basically non-existent
3. Only a handful of maps for multiplayer
4. Not enough weapons and no shotguns

Overall rating: 7.5/10

If you liked the last game you'll love this one. 

Invasion is low key my favorite multiplayer mode I've played in years. I wish other games implemented something like this as seamlessly as Rebellion did here.
